output_list.reason: The function 'distributeToken' has an integer overflow vulnerability. The issue occurs in the line 'balances[msg.sender] -= _value;' where the subtraction operation can overflow due to the large value of '_value' and the initial large 'totalSupply' of the token.

The function 'claimThrone' has a wrong logic vulnerability. The function only checks if 'msg.value' is greater than 'balance' to update the 'king' and 'balance' variables. This can be exploited by attackers to cause a denial of service (DoS) by preventing new kings from being crowned.

The function 'approveAndCall' has an access control vulnerability. It directly assigns a large value to 'allowed[_owner][_spender]' without any authorization check, allowing attackers to set the allowance to any value.
The constructor 'ERC20Token' has a typo that unintentionally exposes it as a public function, allowing anyone to mint unlimited tokens and transfer them to any address.

The function 'mintToken' has a token devaluation vulnerability. It allows the owner to mint unlimited tokens and assign them to any address, causing the token price to crash and financial losses to investors.
